word\/document.xml: CHAPTER SIX:
<g1>CHAPTER SIX:
word/document.xml

True Names and Privacy</g1><x1/>All those who used their knowledge in a bid to enact social change saw cryptography as a tool to enhance individual privacy and to shift power from big, central institutions to the human beings who live in their orbit.

True Names and Privacy</g1><x1/>All those who used their knowledge in a bid to enact social change saw cryptography as a tool to enhance individual privacy and to shift power from big, central institutions to the human beings who live in their orbit.
word/document.xml
—Paul Vigna<x2/>The world needs a new paradigm of privacy because the state will always win under the old paradigm as long as it controls the Identity Industry.
—Paul Vigna<x2/>The world needs a new paradigm of privacy because the state will always win under the old paradigm as long as it controls the Identity Industry.
word/document.xml
The industry consists of far more than government ID and forms to fill out.
The industry consists of far more than government ID and forms to fill out.
word/document.xml
In the last two decades, the Identity Industry has bloated to include airport screening, biometrics, Know Your Customer regulations, clandestine data caches, and surveillance at every turn.
In the last two decades, the Identity Industry has bloated to include airport screening, biometrics, Know Your Customer regulations, clandestine data caches, and surveillance at every turn.
word/document.xml

<g2>Alastair Berg of the RMIT Blockchain Innovation Hub observes, </g2>“These are just a handful of segments in an industry which is estimated to grow to USD16 billion by 2022.”<x3/>The state will not loosen its grip on the industry because identification is an irreplaceable part of social control and the accumulation of wealth.

<g2>Alastair Berg of the RMIT Blockchain Innovation Hub observes, </g2>“These are just a handful of segments in an industry which is estimated to grow to USD16 billion by 2022.”<x3/>The state will not loosen its grip on the industry because identification is an irreplaceable part of social control and the accumulation of wealth.
word/document.xml
This has been true since the Napoleonic era when <g3>an identity card </g3>was introduced that foreshadowed the modern ones.
This has been true since the Napoleonic era when <g3>an identity card </g3>was introduced that foreshadowed the modern ones.
word/document.xml
The purpose of the ID was to control wages by curbing the mobility of workers who wanted to move to get better jobs at higher wages.
The purpose of the ID was to control wages by curbing the mobility of workers who wanted to move to get better jobs at higher wages.
word/document.xml

The cards were instrumental in converting a relatively free France into a police state.<x4/>The state monopoly on identification needs to be broken in the same manner that crypto breaks the monetary monopoly.

The cards were instrumental in converting a relatively free France into a police state.<x4/>The state monopoly on identification needs to be broken in the same manner that crypto breaks the monetary monopoly.
word/document.xml
It should not be confronted; it should be bypassed by providing a better alternative.
It should not be confronted; it should be bypassed by providing a better alternative.
word/document.xml
This not only staves off the state but also provides a free-market alternative for the valid human need for identification.
This not only staves off the state but also provides a free-market alternative for the valid human need for identification.
word/document.xml
Historically, identification was a free-market function; marriage certificates, for example, were a private contract between families and honored by the church.
Historically, identification was a free-market function; marriage certificates, for example, were a private contract between families and honored by the church.
word/document.xml
It can easily be free market again.
It can easily be free market again.
word/document.xml

As long as the Identity Industry is a branch of government, however, this human need will either go unfilled or be satisfied at a staggering cost to freedom.<x5/>The new online paradigm for privacy is here.

As long as the Identity Industry is a branch of government, however, this human need will either go unfilled or be satisfied at a staggering cost to freedom.<x5/>The new online paradigm for privacy is here.
word/document.xml
It is exemplified by the blockchain where interactions are transparent and real identities are protected.
It is exemplified by the blockchain where interactions are transparent and real identities are protected.
word/document.xml
Privacy resides in shielding True Names—a reference to the 1981 pioneering novella by Vernor Vinge in which a group of hackers (called warlocks) penetrate computers around the world.
Privacy resides in shielding True Names—a reference to the 1981 pioneering novella by Vernor Vinge in which a group of hackers (called warlocks) penetrate computers around the world.
word/document.xml
Their real identities are secret from each other and especially from the Great Adversary—a reference to the American state.
Their real identities are secret from each other and especially from the Great Adversary—a reference to the American state.
word/document.xml
Masking real world identities is vital because anyone who knows a warlock's True Name can blackmail him or cause a True Death.
Masking real world identities is vital because anyone who knows a warlock's True Name can blackmail him or cause a True Death.
word/document.xml

Identity is literally a life and death issue.<x6/><g4>The Origin of True Names</g4><x7/>I think the Mailman is taking us on one at a time, starting with the weakest, drawing us in far enough to learn our True Names—and then destroying us.― Vernor Vinge, <g5>True Names<x8/>True Names </g5>is one of the earliest fictional depictions of a fleshed-out cyberspace.

Identity is literally a life and death issue.<x6/><g4>The Origin of True Names</g4><x7/>I think the Mailman is taking us on one at a time, starting with the weakest, drawing us in far enough to learn our True Names—and then destroying us.― Vernor Vinge, <g5>True Names<x8/>True Names </g5>is one of the earliest fictional depictions of a fleshed-out cyberspace.
word/document.xml

It is widely credited with launching the cyberpunks movement, which later explored many of the themes presented in the novella.<x9/><g6>The novella </g6>opens:<x10/>In the once-upon-a-time days of the First Age of Magic, the prudent sorcerer regarded his own true name as his most valued possession but also the greatest threat to his continued good health, for—the stories go—once an enemy, even a weak unskilled enemy, learned the sorcerer's true name, then routine and widely known spells could destroy or enslave even the most powerful.

It is widely credited with launching the cyberpunks movement, which later explored many of the themes presented in the novella.<x9/><g6>The novella </g6>opens:<x10/>In the once-upon-a-time days of the First Age of Magic, the prudent sorcerer regarded his own true name as his most valued possession but also the greatest threat to his continued good health, for—the stories go—once an enemy, even a weak unskilled enemy, learned the sorcerer's true name, then routine and widely known spells could destroy or enslave even the most powerful.
word/document.xml
As times passed, and we graduated to the Age of Reason and thence to the first and second industrial revolutions, such notions were discredited.
As times passed, and we graduated to the Age of Reason and thence to the first and second industrial revolutions, such notions were discredited.
word/document.xml

Now it seems that the Wheel has turned full circle (even if there never really was a First Age) and we are back to worrying about true names again.<x11/>In the story, the protagonist hacker is visited by agents of the Great Enemy who have uncovered his True Name.

Now it seems that the Wheel has turned full circle (even if there never really was a First Age) and we are back to worrying about true names again.<x11/>In the story, the protagonist hacker is visited by agents of the Great Enemy who have uncovered his True Name.
word/document.xml
They strong arm him into tracking down a bigger target known as The Mailman.
They strong arm him into tracking down a bigger target known as The Mailman.
word/document.xml
Thus the story is highly anti-statist with a keen sense of how identity is crucial to freedom.<x12/>The novella spiked the admiration of crypto-anarchists who also drew upon its vision of cyberspace.
Thus the story is highly anti-statist with a keen sense of how identity is crucial to freedom.<x12/>The novella spiked the admiration of crypto-anarchists who also drew upon its vision of cyberspace.
word/document.xml
A later reprint of <g7>True Names </g7>includes ten articles and essays by writers who provide commentary upon Vinge's story.
A later reprint of <g7>True Names </g7>includes ten articles and essays by writers who provide commentary upon Vinge's story.
word/document.xml
One is the essay "True Nyms and Crypto Anarchy" by Timothy May, author of "The Crypto Anarchist Manifesto."
One is the essay "True Nyms and Crypto Anarchy" by Timothy May, author of "The Crypto Anarchist Manifesto."
word/document.xml
(Nyms is short for pseudonyms.)
(Nyms is short for pseudonyms.)
word/document.xml

In the <g8>True Names </g8>tribute, May optimistically states:<x13/>Crypto anarchy is the cyber spatial realization of anarcho-capitalism, transcending national boundaries and freeing individuals to consensually make the economic arrangements they wish to make.<x14/>It ensures that men with guns cannot be brought in to interfere with mutually agreed-upon transactions, the only kind of economics interaction possible in crypto anarchy.

In the <g8>True Names </g8>tribute, May optimistically states:<x13/>Crypto anarchy is the cyber spatial realization of anarcho-capitalism, transcending national boundaries and freeing individuals to consensually make the economic arrangements they wish to make.<x14/>It ensures that men with guns cannot be brought in to interfere with mutually agreed-upon transactions, the only kind of economics interaction possible in crypto anarchy.
word/document.xml

Some people will of course scream “Unfair!” and demand government intervention, which is why strong cryptography will probably be opposed by the masses, unless of course, they are wise and take the long view.

Some people will of course scream “Unfair!” and demand government intervention, which is why strong cryptography will probably be opposed by the masses, unless of course, they are wise and take the long view.
word/document.xml
This may smack of elitism, but I have very little faith in democracy.
This may smack of elitism, but I have very little faith in democracy.
word/document.xml
De Tocqueville warned in 1840 that, roughly translated, “The American Republic will endure until politicians realize they can bribe the people with their own money.”
De Tocqueville warned in 1840 that, roughly translated, “The American Republic will endure until politicians realize they can bribe the people with their own money.”
word/document.xml
We reached that point several decades ago.<x15/>Strong cryptography and the privacy it offers are essential to the success of crypto-anarchy.
We reached that point several decades ago.<x15/>Strong cryptography and the privacy it offers are essential to the success of crypto-anarchy.
word/document.xml
Its antithesis is social control that requires identifying people and linking them to activities in order to be effective.
Its antithesis is social control that requires identifying people and linking them to activities in order to be effective.
word/document.xml
Cryptography snaps this link.
Cryptography snaps this link.
word/document.xml
And not a moment too soon.<x16/>Government ID is currently the only way most people can prove their offline identities in order to access the necessities of modern life.
And not a moment too soon.<x16/>Government ID is currently the only way most people can prove their offline identities in order to access the necessities of modern life.
word/document.xml
In most Western nations, undocumented people cannot board a plane, drive a car, or rent an apartment.
In most Western nations, undocumented people cannot board a plane, drive a car, or rent an apartment.
word/document.xml
They cannot open a bank account, acquire a credit card, access medical care, cash a check, take a visible job, attend a university, or buy a car.
They cannot open a bank account, acquire a credit card, access medical care, cash a check, take a visible job, attend a university, or buy a car.
word/document.xml
They become second-class citizens.<x17/>Meanwhile, those with state ID become vulnerable to prosecution and persecution.
They become second-class citizens.<x17/>Meanwhile, those with state ID become vulnerable to prosecution and persecution.
word/document.xml
In a nationalized ID and reporting system, the government knows who everyone is, what everyone owns, and where to find both.
In a nationalized ID and reporting system, the government knows who everyone is, what everyone owns, and where to find both.
word/document.xml
As Orwell eloquently argues in novels and essays, the nationalization of privacy is a linchpin of totalitarianism.
As Orwell eloquently argues in novels and essays, the nationalization of privacy is a linchpin of totalitarianism.
word/document.xml
No wonder the government’s appetite for data is so ravenous.
No wonder the government’s appetite for data is so ravenous.
word/document.xml

No wonder there is a drive to strip anonymity from the Internet under the aegis of concern about bullying.<x18/>What is needed now is a new paradigm for offline privacy that can work in tandem with online protections.

No wonder there is a drive to strip anonymity from the Internet under the aegis of concern about bullying.<x18/>What is needed now is a new paradigm for offline privacy that can work in tandem with online protections.
word/document.xml
Or, rather, an old paradigm should be revived.
Or, rather, an old paradigm should be revived.
word/document.xml

The offline privacy is best achieved by free-market ID that provides the benefits of identification without the liability of becoming a number in a bureaucratic file.<x19/><g9>Free-Market ID Systems for Offline</g9><x20/>Free-market ID is the antithesis of government ID in that it returns the power of identification back to the individual to use or not according to his own discretion.

The offline privacy is best achieved by free-market ID that provides the benefits of identification without the liability of becoming a number in a bureaucratic file.<x19/><g9>Free-Market ID Systems for Offline</g9><x20/>Free-market ID is the antithesis of government ID in that it returns the power of identification back to the individual to use or not according to his own discretion.
word/document.xml

Free-market ID is a natural ally of cryptography because the goals are the same— to break the state monopoly on the Identity Industry.<x21/>When commerce was on the level of barter, people usually knew or knew of the individuals with whom they traded.

Free-market ID is a natural ally of cryptography because the goals are the same— to break the state monopoly on the Identity Industry.<x21/>When commerce was on the level of barter, people usually knew or knew of the individuals with whom they traded.
word/document.xml
When commerce expanded to include complex exchanges with total strangers a world away, then direct barter was replaced by indirect exchange that often required trust or a middle-man.
When commerce expanded to include complex exchanges with total strangers a world away, then direct barter was replaced by indirect exchange that often required trust or a middle-man.
word/document.xml
A bedrock of trusting someone is the ability to answer the question, “<g10>Who am I dealing with</g10>?”
A bedrock of trusting someone is the ability to answer the question, “<g10>Who am I dealing with</g10>?”
word/document.xml

Thus there is a legitimate need for identification and little danger to it as long as the state is not involved.<x22/>Consider a widespread method of identification from centuries ago that is making a comeback—letters of introduction.

Thus there is a legitimate need for identification and little danger to it as long as the state is not involved.<x22/>Consider a widespread method of identification from centuries ago that is making a comeback—letters of introduction.
word/document.xml
The basic dynamic:
The basic dynamic:
word/document.xml
Person A carries letters of identification to Person C to whom A is a stranger.
Person A carries letters of identification to Person C to whom A is a stranger.
word/document.xml
The letters are written by Person B who is a respected and mutual acquaintance.
The letters are written by Person B who is a respected and mutual acquaintance.
word/document.xml
Person B vouches for the identity of the letter bearer and C is able to answer the question, “Who am I dealing with?”
Person B vouches for the identity of the letter bearer and C is able to answer the question, “Who am I dealing with?”
word/document.xml

Such letters could be prepared by a business that verifies identities for profit.<x23/>An e-version of letters of introduction occurs in crypto circles and on networks whenever a respected member vouches for an outsider who wishes to join.

Such letters could be prepared by a business that verifies identities for profit.<x23/>An e-version of letters of introduction occurs in crypto circles and on networks whenever a respected member vouches for an outsider who wishes to join.
word/document.xml

Given the size of the community and the fact it is under attack, introductions seem to be an increasingly popular practice.<x24/>The letters embody the first and most basic service rendered by free-market ID:

Given the size of the community and the fact it is under attack, introductions seem to be an increasingly popular practice.<x24/>The letters embody the first and most basic service rendered by free-market ID:
word/document.xml
<g11>authentication</g11>.
<g11>authentication</g11>.
word/document.xml
There are myriad reasons why someone would want to authenticate a person’s identity.
There are myriad reasons why someone would want to authenticate a person’s identity.
word/document.xml
The person could be picking up a package, confirming a reservation, joining a club, cashing a check, or applying for a job.
The person could be picking up a package, confirming a reservation, joining a club, cashing a check, or applying for a job.
word/document.xml
The filter of authentication means a stranger cannot commit fraud.<x25/>The free-market authentication of real identities can also be performed by companies that issue ID cards.
The filter of authentication means a stranger cannot commit fraud.<x25/>The free-market authentication of real identities can also be performed by companies that issue ID cards.
word/document.xml
Private ID is common today in a bastardized form that has limited value.
Private ID is common today in a bastardized form that has limited value.
word/document.xml
Employers issue IDs to employees so they can unlocked offices; financial institutions offer credit cards to customers; universities hand out IDs so students can access services.
Employers issue IDs to employees so they can unlocked offices; financial institutions offer credit cards to customers; universities hand out IDs so students can access services.
word/document.xml
But the privacy here is illusory.
But the privacy here is illusory.
word/document.xml
Before an employer or a financial institution issues ID, the recipient is screened in the hiring process or in opening an account .
Before an employer or a financial institution issues ID, the recipient is screened in the hiring process or in opening an account .
word/document.xml
Student cards are prescreened by the extensive paperwork required to enroll in a university.
Student cards are prescreened by the extensive paperwork required to enroll in a university.
word/document.xml
This information is routinely reported to the state in one form or other.
This information is routinely reported to the state in one form or other.
word/document.xml

These semi-private IDs may be a proof of principle, but they are not free market or private.<x26/>The agorist Sunni Maravillosa speculates on what free-market ID might look like in her essay “ID Without Big Brother” in the anthology <g12>National Identification Systems:

These semi-private IDs may be a proof of principle, but they are not free market or private.<x26/>The agorist Sunni Maravillosa speculates on what free-market ID might look like in her essay “ID Without Big Brother” in the anthology <g12>National Identification Systems:
word/document.xml
Essays in Opposition </g12>:<x27/>If an individual wants an ID that attaches a certain label to her, she has several companies to choose from.
Essays in Opposition </g12>:<x27/>If an individual wants an ID that attaches a certain label to her, she has several companies to choose from.
word/document.xml
IDs R Us is a national chain that has minimal requirements for such ID, and offers fast service and low prices.
IDs R Us is a national chain that has minimal requirements for such ID, and offers fast service and low prices.
word/document.xml
However, because it has minimal requirements, its safety record isn’t that great, and many firms do not place much trust in their IDs.
However, because it has minimal requirements, its safety record isn’t that great, and many firms do not place much trust in their IDs.
word/document.xml
The most successful authentication ID issuer is Spooner’s Identity Emporium.
The most successful authentication ID issuer is Spooner’s Identity Emporium.
word/document.xml

This company also has minimal requirements for low-level name-only ID, but it takes the additional step of verifying the ID seeker’s history under that name, as well as the reputation of those who vouch for the ID-seeker.

This company also has minimal requirements for low-level name-only ID, but it takes the additional step of verifying the ID seeker’s history under that name, as well as the reputation of those who vouch for the ID-seeker.
word/document.xml

The company publishes a monthly list on its web site—usually a very short list, given its careful processing—of individuals whose ID has been revoked, along with the reason for revocation...Of course, if an individual doesn’t like the requirements of one company, she’s free to use another...<x28/>Most companies would be careful about accuracy because anyone defrauded by a false document might bring legal action.

The company publishes a monthly list on its web site—usually a very short list, given its careful processing—of individuals whose ID has been revoked, along with the reason for revocation...Of course, if an individual doesn’t like the requirements of one company, she’s free to use another...<x28/>Most companies would be careful about accuracy because anyone defrauded by a false document might bring legal action.
word/document.xml
They would also be careful about client privacy since discretion would be key to the marketability of its ID.
They would also be careful about client privacy since discretion would be key to the marketability of its ID.
word/document.xml

If company- issued IDs facilitate fraud or if client information is leaked, then the publicity alone would damage or ruin the company’s reputation; free-market ID companies would live or die on their reputations.<x29/>The second service free-market ID offers to individuals is <g13>certification</g13>.

If company- issued IDs facilitate fraud or if client information is leaked, then the publicity alone would damage or ruin the company’s reputation; free-market ID companies would live or die on their reputations.<x29/>The second service free-market ID offers to individuals is <g13>certification</g13>.
word/document.xml
Letters of recommendation attest to the character, the education, and specific abilities of the bearer.
Letters of recommendation attest to the character, the education, and specific abilities of the bearer.
word/document.xml
Businesses would be likely to cooperate with each other in providing such letters.
Businesses would be likely to cooperate with each other in providing such letters.
word/document.xml

Maravillosa offers a hypothetical example:<x30/>Banks issue “credit credentials,” which are based on an individual’s or company’s credit history with the bank, so that another individual or institution is satisfied that the entity in question is unlike to default on a loan or other credit arrangement up to a certain amount.<x31/>Again, the crypto version of this service is a personal online recommendation from a trusted figure about a stranger.

Maravillosa offers a hypothetical example:<x30/>Banks issue “credit credentials,” which are based on an individual’s or company’s credit history with the bank, so that another individual or institution is satisfied that the entity in question is unlike to default on a loan or other credit arrangement up to a certain amount.<x31/>Again, the crypto version of this service is a personal online recommendation from a trusted figure about a stranger.
word/document.xml
Alternatively, the outsider could point to certifying documents—perhaps scholarly articles he has written on relevant subjects.
Alternatively, the outsider could point to certifying documents—perhaps scholarly articles he has written on relevant subjects.
word/document.xml
His reputation itself can be a certifying ID.<x32/>Some forms of current ID perform a similar function.
His reputation itself can be a certifying ID.<x32/>Some forms of current ID perform a similar function.
word/document.xml

University degrees purportedly certify a level of education and intelligence; a letter of reference from an employer describes the laudable work habits of a former employee; membership in professional or charitable organizations suggests a person’s character and social skills.<x33/>There is a marked downside to many current certifications, however.

University degrees purportedly certify a level of education and intelligence; a letter of reference from an employer describes the laudable work habits of a former employee; membership in professional or charitable organizations suggests a person’s character and social skills.<x33/>There is a marked downside to many current certifications, however.
word/document.xml
One of them:
One of them:
word/document.xml
State licenses and diplomas frequently substitute for free-market methods of certification.
State licenses and diplomas frequently substitute for free-market methods of certification.
word/document.xml
Everything from neurosurgery to braiding dreadlocks requires licenses, and these tend to replace reputation as a measure of worth.
Everything from neurosurgery to braiding dreadlocks requires licenses, and these tend to replace reputation as a measure of worth.
word/document.xml
An example:
An example:
word/document.xml
A non-traditional healer is well know for his skill, but he is unable to obtain a license.
A non-traditional healer is well know for his skill, but he is unable to obtain a license.
word/document.xml
His reputation is stellar, but local doctors block the licensing process in order to eliminate their competition.
His reputation is stellar, but local doctors block the licensing process in order to eliminate their competition.
word/document.xml
The healer is unable to treat people without the risk of going to jail.
The healer is unable to treat people without the risk of going to jail.
word/document.xml
State-mandated diplomas—even if they have value, which is increasingly in doubt—are barriers to those who are talented but not state sanctioned.
State-mandated diplomas—even if they have value, which is increasingly in doubt—are barriers to those who are talented but not state sanctioned.
word/document.xml
In this manner, the state devalues or negates the worth of reputation.<x34/>The third purpose of free-market ID is to <g14>authorize </g14>specific actions.
In this manner, the state devalues or negates the worth of reputation.<x34/>The third purpose of free-market ID is to <g14>authorize </g14>specific actions.
word/document.xml
Letters can assign limited rights to the bearer.
Letters can assign limited rights to the bearer.
word/document.xml

An attorney’s firm might assign a limited power to one of its lawyers so he can settle a case on the behalf of a client.<x35/><g15>Objections to Free-Market ID</g15><x36/>Objections to free-market identification arise.

An attorney’s firm might assign a limited power to one of its lawyers so he can settle a case on the behalf of a client.<x35/><g15>Objections to Free-Market ID</g15><x36/>Objections to free-market identification arise.
word/document.xml
The methods of identification are said to be antiquated, to not provide real anonymity, and to have no uniformity.
The methods of identification are said to be antiquated, to not provide real anonymity, and to have no uniformity.
word/document.xml
Besides which, establishing a reputation is a slow process in a fast-moving world.<x37/><g16>Antiquated</g16>.
Besides which, establishing a reputation is a slow process in a fast-moving world.<x37/><g16>Antiquated</g16>.
word/document.xml
Some models of identification may be outmoded.
Some models of identification may be outmoded.
word/document.xml
But the surest remedy for this is to open up to field and let the marketplace innovate.
But the surest remedy for this is to open up to field and let the marketplace innovate.
word/document.xml
The most antiquated IDs are the ones produced by the stagnant state.<x38/><g17>No Anonymity</g17>.
The most antiquated IDs are the ones produced by the stagnant state.<x38/><g17>No Anonymity</g17>.
word/document.xml
The primary purpose of early ID was to verify identity, not to render anonymity.
The primary purpose of early ID was to verify identity, not to render anonymity.
word/document.xml
And there is still a free-market demand to verify identity.
And there is still a free-market demand to verify identity.
word/document.xml
There<x39/>is value in anonymity; there is value in being known.
There<x39/>is value in anonymity; there is value in being known.
word/document.xml
The value depends on whether the individual is able to choose freely between the two.<x40/><g18>No uniformity.
The value depends on whether the individual is able to choose freely between the two.<x40/><g18>No uniformity.
word/document.xml
Another word for “no uniformity” is “diversity,” and it is one of the extreme advantages of free-market ID because it gives choice.
</g18>Another word for “no uniformity” is “diversity,” and it is one of the extreme advantages of free-market ID because it gives choice.
word/document.xml
Government ID is homogenized because the goal is to enforce conformity to laws and reporting requirements.
Government ID is homogenized because the goal is to enforce conformity to laws and reporting requirements.
word/document.xml
When ID serves individuals, then its form is dictated by their needs and preferences, not by the state.<x41/><g19>Slow to Establish Trust or Reputation</g19>.
When ID serves individuals, then its form is dictated by their needs and preferences, not by the state.<x41/><g19>Slow to Establish Trust or Reputation</g19>.
word/document.xml
It is a fast-moving world.
It is a fast-moving world.
word/document.xml
But the fact that a reputation or a business may take time and hard work to establish is hardly a criticism.
But the fact that a reputation or a business may take time and hard work to establish is hardly a criticism.
word/document.xml
Worthwhile achievements take time and hard work.<x42/><g20>The State’s Nuclear Option in Weaponizing Data</g20><x43/>Privacy includes the ability to keep things secret from the government…
Worthwhile achievements take time and hard work.<x42/><g20>The State’s Nuclear Option in Weaponizing Data</g20><x43/>Privacy includes the ability to keep things secret from the government…
word/document.xml
.I might be keeping secret my weakness for alcohol, or heroin, or gambling or pornography and so preventing the government from stepping in to protect me from myself…
.I might be keeping secret my weakness for alcohol, or heroin, or gambling or pornography and so preventing the government from stepping in to protect me from myself…
word/document.xml
.If you view government as a benevolent super being watching over you—a wise and kindly uncle with a long white beard—you will and should reject much of what I am saying.
.If you view government as a benevolent super being watching over you—a wise and kindly uncle with a long white beard—you will and should reject much of what I am saying.
word/document.xml
But government is not Uncle Sam or a philosopher king.
But government is not Uncle Sam or a philosopher king.
word/document.xml
Government is a set of institutions through which human beings act for human purposes.
Government is a set of institutions through which human beings act for human purposes.
word/document.xml

Its special feature—what differentiates political action from the other ways in which we try to get what we want—is that government is permitted to use force to make people do things.—David Friedman<x44/>Government is not a wise and kindly uncle.

Its special feature—what differentiates political action from the other ways in which we try to get what we want—is that government is permitted to use force to make people do things.—David Friedman<x44/>Government is not a wise and kindly uncle.

It is self-serving institution occupied by human beings with human passions, especially for power, wealth, status, moralizing, and revenge.

There are many paths to privacy, not just one.<x56/>Before answering “What should you do?,” some distinctions are useful.

All information is not equal, and encrypting everything may draw unwanted attention.
All information is not equal, and encrypting everything may draw unwanted attention.
word/document.xml
You might consider encrypting only information that is important to your freedom, wealth, and well-being.
You might consider encrypting only information that is important to your freedom, wealth, and well-being.

Everyone has at least three kinds of personal data.
word/document.xml
First, there are data that should be broadcast widely, such as an employment resume.
First, there are data that should be broadcast widely, such as an employment resume.

This information requires marketing, not privacy.

Second, there are facts that are harmless to disclose, such as a favorite color or a preference in potato chips.

Here is a sampling of some basic, effective techniques:<x64/><g35>Obfuscate or “hide in plain sight.”
